title: Contributing to hubCI
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("hubverse-org/hubCI", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Follow pull request checklist create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("name/brief-description/issue"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first heading—usually labelled “development version”). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Hubverse GitHub Action setup — use_hub_github_action
text: Sets common continuous integration (CI) workflows hub hosted GitHub using GitHub Actions. Available actions hosted repository hubverse-org/hubverse-actions function creates necessary directories downloads requested GitHub Action yaml file.

title: Hubverse GitHub Action setup — use_hub_github_action
text: name Name workflow, .e. name one action repository directories containing GitHub Action workflow .yaml file. ref Desired Git reference, usually name tag ("v0.1.0") branch ("main"). possibilities include commit SHA ("d1c516d") "HEAD" (meaning "tip remote's default branch"). specified, defaults latest published release hubverse-org/hubverse-actions (https://github.com/hubverse-org/hubverse-actions/releases)
